editionStmt.p: The initial version of this file was created from data kindly provided by the Ethiopic Manuscript Imaging Project directed by Steve Delamarter.

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

licence.p: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msContents.summary: Images 5r-178l: Homiliary in honor of the Archangel Michael, Dǝrsanä Mika’el, ድርሳነ፡ ሚካኤል፡, arranged for the months of the year: Ḫədar (image 13r), Taḫśaś (33r), Ṭərr (45l), Yäkkatit (60r), Mäggabit (67r); Miyazya (94r), Gənbot (106l); Säne (113l), Ḥamle (127r), Näḥase (139r), Mäskäräm (160l), Ṭəqəmt (167l). Published several times in Ethiopia; see, for example, ድርሳነ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ወድርሳነ፡ ሩፋኤል፡ መልክአ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ወመልክአ፡ ሩፋኤል፡ (Addis Ababa: Täsfa, 1940 E.C.) 11–205. See also BL Or. 4849, StrBL 94–7; EMML 1133. Varia: Image 1r: unidentified text, written in pencil. Image 2r, top: unidentified text in Amharic. Image 2r, middle (in red ink): unidentified text. Image 2r, bottom: Two records: The first is the notice of the sale of a slave. It begins with the location in ከሲ. The buyer is ፊታውራሪ መስቀሉ. The name of the slave is ወናኖ የሮ, who is called a slave (ባራ). Given as a gift (ሲሰጥ). Six witnesses are listed. The date is given: Ṭəqəmt 26, 1910 EC. In Addis Ababa. The second record is about the sale of ወጨፎ (brand name) guns from Ato አበበ to ፊታውራሪ መስቀሉ. Six witnesses are given. The date is in Amharic.Ṭəqəmt 23, 1910 EC in Arada. The illuminations appear authentic. Image 25l (and passim) mention owners, ወልደ መስቀል and ወለተ ሐዋርያት, and the scribe, ኃይለ ሥላሲ. Images 180r-181l: unidentified text about angels at the resurrection of Jesus.
